info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 6:35PM EDT until April 6 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following county, Stark.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding is ongoing or imminent along the Sandy Creek in and near Waynesburg.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 629 PM EDT, At 600 PM EDT, the stage at the Sandy Creek in Waynesburg was 8.0 feet and rising. Flood stage is 8.0 feet. The creek is likely to crest between 8.5 feet and 9.0 feet later this evening before falling below flood stage overnight. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.6 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waynesburg. - At 8.0 feet, water is out of the banks of Sandy Creek. At 8.5 feet, water approaches homes on Grovedell and Broadford Streets in Waynesburg with water in basements likely. At 9.0 feet, water encroaches onto routes 183 and 43 in Waynesburg.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SUNDAY
